answer: Access Camera’s Web UI; Initialize Camera; Verify/Modify Camera Encoding Settings; Enable Motion Detection; Connect & Add Camera(s) to Turing NVR
Locate your camera’s IP address; enter your camera’s IP address into a browser search bar
The web UI will prompt you to create a new password for your camera; click Apply to initialize camera(s)
Go to Basic > Video Profile on the camera’s web UI
Turing recommends using CBR (Constant Bitrate) for both streams.
Go to Analytics > Motion Detection; click Enable motion detection checkbox; edit detection area, level of detection, sensitivity, and minimum duration as desired; click Apply to save settings
detection area; level of detection; sensitivity; minimum duration
Click Apply to save all settings after enabling and configuring motion detection.
Access Turing NVR web UI by entering its IP address in a browser; login and go to Setup > Camera > Camera; select the channel and click Modify; edit the username and password fields; click Save
Enter the Turing NVR's IP address into a web browser
Click the Installation Video link in the guide
Turing Smart NVR and Turing Vision only support Motion events from Hanwha cameras; Smart VCA events are not supported
Use Wisenet’s Device Manager to locate your camera’s IP address
Create a new password for your camera; click Apply to initialize camera(s)
CBR is recommended for stable recording
Go to Analytics > Motion Detection; click Enable motion detection checkbox; edit detection area, level of detection, sensitivity, and minimum duration as desired; click Apply to save settings
detection area; level of detection; sensitivity; minimum duration
Click Apply to save all settings
Use Wisenet’s Device Manager to initialize and modify network settings for multiple cameras
Yes, plugging into the NVR is acceptable if you want to connect directly without a separate switch.
If only MJPEG is available, the NVR will use MJPEG.
Go to Basic > Video Profile; modify the encoding settings to the Turing recommended settings

motion detection must be enabled on the camera
Go to Analytics > Motion Detection; adjust sensitivity there
Go to Analytics > Motion Detection; edit the detection area to define motion zones.
Go to Analytics > Motion Detection; edit the level of detection and sensitivity fields
Go to Analytics > Motion Detection in the camera’s web UI; edit the minimum duration setting
Click Modify; edit the username and password fields; click Save
Yes; you need to enter the NVR’s IP address into a web browser to access the web UI and log in.

Edit the level of detection and sensitivity in Analytics > Motion Detection
Edit the detection area in Analytics > Motion Detection to ignore motion in specific parts of the scene
Main profile = Profile 1; Sub profile = Profile 2

Smart VCA Events; only Motion events are supported
